storyInfo: Elena receives a responsibility identification report from the Defense Section for violating the laboratory's safety procedures. Ferdinand, the director of the Energy Section knocks on her lab's door, and a series of 'experiments' focused on her begins.

attributes.content: 'Rhine Defense Section Responsibility Identification Report: Intern Researcher Elena Urbica...'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: 'Violation of laboratory operation procedures, violation of researcher safety code, violation of Defense Section rescue plans...'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: 'Returned to the site of the liquid Originium leakage without permission and reactivated the abandoned experiment reaction device...'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: 'Disrupting the Defense Section's predetermined rescue procedures, leading to a more difficult rescue...'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Elena takes a deep breath.
It's so over...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Now that Defense has sent me the responsibility identification report, considering Director Saria's personality...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I'm so fired.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Elena takes a look at the laboratory around her.
Her equipment and instruments are piled in the corner of a common workspace. On her desk is her unfinished report, as well as half a bag of stimulants left behind from yesterday.
Oh... What a shame. This is my first big experiment, and I'm getting the pink slip before I could achieve anything...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Astesia's bound to find out sooner or later, too... She's going to worry...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: ...but I guess I should prepare...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: She sighs, sets down the report in her hands, and starts picking up her things on the desk and putting them in her bag one-by-one.
Director Clooney...!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: (Why is the director here? Are things that serious...?)
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Intern Researcher... Elena Urbica?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Yes, that's me.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Did an experiment of this caliber really call for a visit from a director...?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Elena, what's your data point at right now?
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: ...1.39. Hasn't changed...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: What's going on? It's the 23rd day. All the other data points are fine. Normally, I would've gotten results last week, but it's not reacting whatsoever!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: It's stressing me out so much...!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Kid, why don't you come over for a cup of tea?
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: No, Wally... I'm not in the mood for tea...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: How about this, then? I'll teach you a good way. Fill this out, and you won't be so stressed out anymore.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: What is this... 'Experiment Project Application Form?'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Why should I fill this out?!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: So you stop looking at this experiment that's half-abandoned by the project. Instead, try thinking about what you'll do for your next experiment, how you'll get results, and do that.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Look at me. The first thing I did when I got to work was grab a cup of tea. With my last experiment dead in the water, I'm starting to figure out my next idea. That's how things go. We're doing research. No way are we gonna succeed every single time.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Elena, if you're really worried that Ferdinand's going to fire you, stop wasting your time on this. He's not going to care about a single experiment.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: All he's going to say is, 'Rhine has thousands of experiments going every day. All I care about are the results in the end.'
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Pff... You do a good Ferdinand.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: But this experiment isn't anything on that level... This is a fundamental data experiment of B25. It's my first big one. I put in lots of effort to get this project!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: It's way too important to me, and I can't give up the chance to participate in a huge project just like that...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: If you have a backup plan to remedy things, he's not going to be that bothered by this one experiment. At most, he'll chew you out in person.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: (Shudders)
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: I still haven't met Director Clooney. Why does it seem like everyone in Energy is scared of him?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: You'll know as soon as you talk to him. Trust me, when he gives you a compliment, it's going to feel way worse than when he reprimands you.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: But you still chose to join Energy?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Well... You gotta hand it to him. He's a real force to be reckoned with.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: If you happen to work on a project he leads, on just that one project, the experience you'll earn is worth years of fiddling on a project by yourself. The only problem is not a lot of people catch his eye. Sometimes, there's not even one in a year.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: That's the reason why most of us chose to join Energy. Isn't that why you're here, too?
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: Well, yeah. I heard about his achievements when I was still in college, and I figured he must be a really exceptional man, and that my dreams would definitely come true if I went to Energy.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Besides, it's not so strange for a man as peerless and respected as him to have a bit of a temper, right?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Elena sets her arms on the table and props herself up.
Hmph, I swear to god, I will find the problem with the experiment.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: This is my first experiment, and a fundamental data point of B25! It wasn't easy for me to earn this chance!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: If the two old fossils back home were to catch wind of this, they'd say I should've followed their decision and drag me back home to join them in their chicanery... Astesia would be so worried, too...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Yeah, I don't buy it! How is this possible? Is it really not going to yield any results?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Well, hang in there if you're so enthusiastic about it. Good luck...
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: *Bzzt*—*Bzzt*—*Bzzt*—
What's that noise? Is that the alarm?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Uh, is something wrong? Temperature? Humidity? Let me check the numbers.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: ...'Indoor Originium concentration...?'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Elena shoots out of her seat and dashes straight toward the base's alarm system.
What's going on? The laboratory's Originium concentration is way above alarm levels! Is there a liquid Originium leakage?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Hurry! Put on your masks!
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: Defense? This is Site 013. The internal environmental Originium concentration has exceeded the limit. We think there might be a liquid Originium leakage! We've sounded the alarm and told everyone to evacuate, but we need Defense here to help us!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Yes, Site 013. The Originium concentration has far exceeded limits. We don't know the source of the leakage. We need immediate assistance!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: So as soon as I noticed the Originium concentrations were way too high, I pulled the alarm, reported the incident to Defense, and notified all the personnel on the base to evacuate.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I stopped my experiment and sealed any material that can easily react to the high concentrations to keep the followup damage control work as easy as possible. I also notified our subcontractors and the Pioneer base.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: This is my first project at Rhine, so after that, I...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: That's not what I wanted to hear.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Ferdinand's eyes sweep the desktop that Elena is halfway through cleaning up.
You are cleaning up?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: You have only seven minutes of my time. Put your things down, and look at this.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Is this... the data report? It's out already?!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Director, are they valuable data? Are they very important?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You craftfully wasted the resources I gave you, and filled my inbox with the Defense Section's responsibility identification reports.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I hope you'll remember every safety notice on the wall.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I'm very sorry, Director. I wasn't able to submit the experiment's data results before the due date. I will sort out the rest and hand it to the next overseer.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I will talk to the project's manager about the problems I caused because of the delay, and do my best to remedy all this.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Very well, but I don't care about any of that.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: What I want to know is why you went back to the laboratory.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Because I thought I heard something...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: *Bzzt*—*Bzzt*—*Bzzt*—
(I'm pretty sure I heard something just now... Did my experiment's reaction indicator go off...?)
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Finally made it out... Goodness... How many people are they going to fire for a blunder like this...?
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: (Did it finally start reacting...?)
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Good for you, Elena. You really don't have to worry about your experiment anymore.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: From the looks of it, just about all the projects on the site will be delayed.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: What the hell is going on?! What are you people even doing in there?
attributes.name: Flustered Pioneer

attributes.content: Wally... We've had experiments that succeeded in unusual environments before, right?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Yeah, we did. We usually call those the 'Providence of Truth.' If luck's on your side, it's bound to happen once or twice.
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Hold on, mind checking if I've got my protective mask on properly? I'm kinda worried still...
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech B

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: (I'm pretty sure I heard it. My experiment's reacting!)
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Are we safe here? You sure we shouldn't run a little farther? Into a shelter or something?
attributes.name: Panicked Subcontractor

attributes.content: You maniacs...! We're going to get infected... This is completely against the terms of that contract we signed!
attributes.name: Panicked Subcontractor

attributes.content: Hmph, what's the big deal, as long as you're alive? At least there's a girl telling you to run this time.
attributes.name: Indifferent Pioneer

attributes.content: Hold on... Hey... Did any of you see Elena...? Why isn't she here?
attributes.name: Rhine Lab Tech A

attributes.content: *Bzzt*—! *Bzzt*—! *Bzzt*—!
Elena makes her way to her desk.

In the empty laboratory, the blaring alarm and the noise of the indicators are jumbled together in dissonance. The Originium concentration here has already reached a level that can easily infect humans.
On the lab table left cluttered because of the sudden evacuation, the abandoned experiment is reacting to the Originium leakage, with its indicator dial swinging rapidly.

As though it is outputting all the results that previously never appeared all at once. The terminal's display to the side is quickly displaying a number of the experiment's data points as the alarm's light flashes to no end.
I knew it...! *cough*. I knew I heard it!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I knew it! I knew it! *cough*... It moved! Finally, results!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Sparing no time to fetch the chair that she had kicked to the side, Elena kneels in front of her desk and quickly records each and every data point.
The readout's 1.97. I need to plug it into the formula and calculate the result...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Environmental concentration...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Save file...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Who's still in there?!
attributes.name: Defense Section Employee

attributes.content: Elena leans down and keeps quiet. She picks up her recording's pace.
We've cleared this area already. Is there still somebody inside?
attributes.name: Defense Section Employee

attributes.content: Rescue target's location confirmed. We missed someone earlier.
attributes.name: Defense Section Employee

attributes.content: There's no time. Last row...!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: It was my first project, and I really took it seriously.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: When I found out that it finally started to react, my immediate guess was that the parameters and environment I was operating the experiment within were too idealistic, and it didn't reach the prerequisites for the reaction to occur.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I had to record the results I got in a high Originium concentration environment. Even if the data were just an anomaly, it will definitely help our experiments in the future.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: And even if it wasn't going to yield any results, I had to make sure.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: That's why... I went back.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: You have four minutes left. Is that it?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: This is hardly a special reason at all.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: And? What was the first thing you asked me after you got the report?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: 'Are the data valuable?'
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: They aren't. Are you going to snatch them back?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: And your reason?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I don't want to give up on the results of my hours upon hours of work.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: ...Even if they have already been abandoned by the others.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: But having put in so much effort for so long, I didn't think that much about it.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: It reacted in that environment. It could very well be an all new data point or formula, and that would be my achievement.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: If I could just reach that, I would be going another step further. I could continue my experiment or research something more fundamental... Besides, I might just succeed, and I think I will!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Stop. Stop wasting your time. You don't have to tell me all that.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Ferdinand points out the window.

Researchers like you are a dime a dozen here at this site. Each and every one of them have been praised by just as many for their traits, intelligence, determination, and leadership... How many tons of scrap paper do you think they produce every day?
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: When these qualities become commonplace, they are nothing special.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: You made a decision to chase that data. Not bad, but it wasn't enough. I don't need someone who wastes her time and risks her life for mere scrap paper.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: But we had a liquid Originium leakage at the time. I assessed the emergency at hand and—
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: No, what you need to assess is the value of the experiment's data.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Otherwise, all you did was make an impulsive decision.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: When you're free, you should spend a little time outside the laboratory.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: It should be greater foresight and knowledge that drive your decision. It should be those things that help you find results worth risking your life for, not 'didn't think that much about it.'
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I understand... Thank you for your guidance, Director. From here on out, I will first determine whether the results are worth it before making my decision, instead of letting my impulse drive me.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: What if I determined that the data were very valuable in that kind of environment?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Ferdinand's gaze snaps back onto her.
He looks straight at Elena.
Elena is looking up and right into his eyes, like all the other students that sought his guidance.
He smiles.
If it were me, I would've pulled the alarm a little later.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Ferdinand checks his watch and interrupts her.
Those people are also things that you have to assess beforehand.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Seven minutes. Here's your document. Take it.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I've already put together all the remaining data from the last experiment and the relevant reports, and I'll finish the handover work as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: I'm sorry for all the trouble I caused Energy, and I'll take care of this before I leave Rhine Lab...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Ferdinand

attributes.content: Elena looks around the laboratory one last time. In the end, her eyes land on the alarm system.
'If it were me, I would've pulled the alarm a little later...' huh...?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Elena shakes her head.
I'd still have pulled the alarm first.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: The sound of Ferdinand's footsteps disappears down the hallway.
Phew—
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Let's get back to it.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Hm... What's this?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: There are two documents sitting on the desk that she had cleaned out.
Elena picks them up. The one on top is the report of the experiment's data that she fought so hard for.
Too bad, the experiment's materials were destroyed. If I ever get the chance, maybe I'll try to reproduce it. Not sure if my next company will have Rhine's resources, though...
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: A confirmation of transfer to Energy Section Director Ferdinand's own projects...?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Ah!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Ahhh! For real?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Really? Really?!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Elena lifts the confirmation up in the air, jumps up, and bumps her head into the corner of the cabinet.
Oww...!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: She cheerfully falls on the backpack that she packed, and kicks her legs in the air as she repeatedly confirms the document's details.

When her breathing finally stabilizes once more, she carefully puts away the confirmation. She brushes the hair feathers that she messed up during her bout of excitement, sits back down, and opens her backpack.
If I'd known, I wouldn't have packed up my data report.
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: *cough*. Calm down...! Relax!
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Let's see. Where exactly did the experiment go wrong, and why did it only start reacting in the end...?
attributes.name: Elena

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Elena
